conclusion: Consider the forces acting on the system and the equilibrium conditions.
The weight of the mass m is suspended at point C.
The two ropes AC and BD are connected to the ceiling and have a length of 2L.
The weight of the mass m is suspended at point C.
The weight of the mass m is acting vertically downward.
The tension in the AC rope is T1.
The tension in the BD rope is T2.
The net force acting on point C must be zero.
The sum of the forces in the vertical direction must be zero.
The tension in the AC rope is the weight of the mass m minus the tension in the BD rope, T1 = mg - T2.
The tension in the BD rope is the weight of the mass m minus the tension in the AC rope, T2 = mg - T1.
The net force acting on point C must be zero.
The sum of the forces in the horizontal direction must be zero.
The horizontal force is the weight of the mass m, therefore, the horizontal force is mg.
The vertical force is the tension in the AC rope minus the tension in the BD rope, therefore, the vertical force is T1 - T2.
The net force acting on point C must be zero.
The sum of the forces in the vertical direction must be zero.
Set up the equations: T1 - T2 = 0 and mg = 0.
From the first equation, T1 = T2.
From the second equation, T2 = mg.
From the first equation, T1 = mg - T2.
From the second equation, T2 = mg.
The minimum value of force that can be applied on point D is the tension in the BD rope, therefore, the minimum value of force that can be applied on point D is mg.
